title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Thursday 18 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: megan bannister death : two men in court charged with manslaughter .
son admits stabbing father to death .
teenager appears in court charged with leicester murder .
man speaks out after kim jong-un family goes viral .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the east midlands live page - updates will start again tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: notts sign hawkridge from lincoln
text: notts sign hawkridge from lincoln

documents.title: football : 'valuable ' defender barker gets six-month burton deal
text: the burton albion manager nigel clough says defender shaun barker is a valuable squad member , following the news he 's signed a new six-month contract .
the 34-year-old 's deal is the third short-term contract he has signed since joining the championship club last summer after four injury-plagued years .
barker only made five substitute appearances , but helped the brewers avoid relegation .
six months is perfect .
physically i feel no different than i did in my mid-20s .
i am fit enough and can still do sessions like everyone else .
but i have a reaction with my knee so have to be careful . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: east midlands weather update : rain to return overnight
text: it 'll be dry this evening but cloud will increase overnight .
rain , which may be heavy at times , will move in during the early hours .
lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: chesterfield sign defender barry
text: chesterfield sign defender barry

documents.title: watch : dry weather reveals reservoir 's past
text: it might be hard to believe after yesterday 's downpour , but water levels at the beautiful derwent reservoir in the peak district are much lower than usual .
the receding water has revealed a mysterious set of pillars , which played a crucial role in the building of the reservoir just over a century ago .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: eight men arrested on day of notts county v mansfield fixture
text: eight men have been arrested in connection with public order offences at a nottingham city centre pub on the day of a notts county versus mansfield town match .
the disorder took place at the major oak pub during the afternoon of 14 january , nottinghamshire police said .
the men , aged between 18 and 56 , remain in police custody .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham dancers to perform at chelsea flower show
text: nine nottingham dancers are heading to this year 's renowned chelsea flower show .
dancers from the dance studios will be taking part in the show to perform a tap piece .
the girls , aged between 12 and 15 , have been specially selected to perform an exclusive dance - set to michael flatley 's feet of the flames .

maxine loydall , director at the dance studios , said : `` the chance for these girls from a nottingham city centre dance school to perform at such a world famous event like the chelsea flower show is a real privilege . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: son admits stabbing father to death
text: a 31-year-old man has pleaded guilty to murdering his father at the house they shared .
geoff seggie ( below ) was found dead at his home in marylebone crescent , mackworth , during the night on 1 december .
mr seggie , 59 , described by his family as a `` hero '' , had suffered multiple stab wounds , derbyshire police said .
daniel seggie , who lived at the same address , admitted murder at nottingham crown court and is due to be sentenced on 31 may .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pictures emerge of rubbish pile dumped at stapleford woods
text: gas cylinders , white goods and a chair are among the items that have been found fly-tipped at stapleford woods on the nottinghamshire-lincolnshire border .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: oakley to retire at end of season
text: oakley to retire at end of season

documents.title: watch : new forest owner wants to work with fans
text: nottingham forest have a new owner - it 's greek shipping magnate evangelos marinakis .
he 's already the owner and president of greek club olympiacos , and now marinakis has an 80 % stake in forest .
he 's promising stability and investment - but he 's facing accusations of match-fixing in greece .
however , he has passed the efl 's owners ' and directors ' test .
he has been speaking to the bbc about getting the fans involved in decision making
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

text: son admits stabbing father to death

documents.title: stags sign angol and white from posh
text: stags sign angol and white from posh

documents.title: teenager appears in court charged with leicester murder
text: a 17-year-old boy has appeared at leicester magistrates ' court charged with the murder of 22-year-old abdirahman adam , who died from a stab wound after being found injured in st matthews way , leicester , on monday .
the teenager , who can not be named for legal reasons , has also been charged with possession of an offensive weapon in a public place .
during the hearing , the boy confirmed his name and age .
he has now been remanded in custody .
he will next appear at leicester crown court tomorrow morning .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: forest green sign mansfield 's collins
text: forest green sign mansfield 's collins

documents.title: derby charity praises bbc drama three girls
text: a derby charity - which works with victims of child abuse - has praised a bbc drama about grooming .
three girls stars two derby actresses and focuses on child grooming in rochdale - a case which led to nine men being jailed .
nwg network chief executive officer ( ceo ) sheila taylor believes we all have to be aware of grooming in all its many guises .
the value of seeing a drama like this is that it does create a public awareness .
i think the portrayal of what happened is quiet accurate to a number of cases that we 've seen . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stags sign striker angol for undisclosed fee
text: lee 's five goals helped lincoln city win promotion from the national league last season
breaking news : stags sign highly-rated posh striker for undisclosed fee pictured here with ceo @ twitterid
is it the one on the left
thought you 'd say that
should fit in being a knobhead
she been polishing her head ?
horrendous lack of ambition for someone 'highly rated ' .
'highly rated ' he 's that high rated they sent him out on loan last season then sold him to a lower league club
ye proper jealous i never heard of the lad
he could n't even get into our side he 's shit
diamonds a good one.we signed him .
had a bad attitude and got rid .
he thinks he 's better than what he is .
so funny seeing him go conference
he played 11 games , scored in 3 of them , and the only result that would change if his goals were taken out was after we 'd already gone up
why is carolyn radford wearing notts county colours ?
cos it 's fancy dress day today mate
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested after police chase crash
text: a man has been arrested after a car crashed following a police chase in sutton-in-ashfield last night .
officers were called to forest road , skegby , at about 19:00 following reports that a man was trying to kick a door down .
nottinghamshire police said when officers arrived , they tried to stop a car that had been seen driving away sus but the car continued to drive away at speed before crashing on dalestorth road .
the 29-year-old driver was arrested in a nearby garden on sus of drug and driving offences as well as possession of an offensive weapon .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged over pensioner 'row ' death
text: man charged over pensioner 'row ' death

documents.title: barker extends burton albion contract
text: barker extends burton albion contract

documents.title: argos warehouse workers begin two weeks of strike action
text: warehouse workers at argos in lutterworth are among 1,400 union members that have taken strike action in a dispute over job security and terms and conditions .
the union unite claims argos is planning to transfer nearly 500 workers from its lutterworth distribution hub to wincanton logistics in kettering .
the workers - who prepare deliveries for argos stores - are fearful that a `` contracting out culture '' will lead to job losses and a deterioration of working conditions , the union added .
the walkout - which began this morning - is expected to last two weeks .
argos has said customers wo n't be affected
we strongly believe this dispute to be wholly unnecessary as the union has made a series of demands in the full knowledge that they can not be met for legal reasons .
we can reassure customers that we have strong contingencies in place and their orders and deliveries will not be affected . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: megan bannister death : third man arrested
text: a third person has been arrested in the investigation into the death of 16-year-old megan bannister .
a 34-year-old has been detained on sus of possession with intent to supply class a drugs .
he remains in police custody .
jason burder , 28 , of braunstone avenue , leicester , and adam king , 27 , of waltham avenue , leicester , appeared in court earlier today over megan 's death .
they were arrested and later charged with gross negligence manslaughter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shaun barker signs new contract with burton albion
text: shaun barker has signed a new six-month contract with burton albion .
the former derby county defender joined the club last august having been sidelined for more than four years with injury .
barker 's new deal will keep him at the pirelli stadium until january 2018 .
author: Joe Shennan
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: megan bannister death : men appear in court
text: two leicester men have appeared in court in connection with the death of megan bannister .
jason burder ( left ) , 28 , from braunstone avenue , and adam king ( right ) , 27 , from waltham avenue , have both been charged with gross negligence manslaughter .
megan 's body was found in a car which had been involved in a collision with a motorbike on desford road in enderby on sunday .
the pair were refused bail and are due to appear at leicester crown court on 15 june .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your comments : 'it 's an iconic structure '
text: yesterday we told you about the charity sustrans bidding for £ 6m to restore the bennerley viaduct between awsworth and eastwood into a cycling and walking route .
this got you talking over on our facebook page
tina walker said : `` great idea , let 's hope it gets the go ahead . ''
garald barrass wrote : `` money can be spent better elsewhere . ''
brian gamble also wrote : `` it is an iconic structure and should be put to use . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: nottinghamshire archer continues to make bows after 55 years
text: is this nottingham 's modern day robin hood ?
as well as being a keen archer , keith gascoigne has been making bows for 55 years .
he 's also based just a stone 's throw from sherwood forest .
his craftsmanship might not have benefitted the famous local figure , but he has made three bows that have been used , and won medals , in the paralympic games .
prince charles was also presented with one of his bows when he visited a school in the county .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: man speaks out after kim jong-un family goes viral
text: if you like your social media , chances are you are going to have seen these doing the rounds .
jake slater , from derby , tweeted them on 5 may after his brother ben changed a family in the hallway from a of ben at a cousin 's christening to a of north korea leader kim jong-un .
the original tweet has now been retweeted more than 64,000 times and liked more than 151,000 times .
ben spoke to us today and told us how he did it to `` make a few people laugh '' .
i just got a bit bored and thought it might make a few people laugh .
it was up there for about a week to start with , then i told my brother .
then another week went by and my mum and dad did n't even notice .
the photo 's still on the wall , it 's not changed , it 'll stay there until somebody can be bothered to change it . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police appeal following six distraction burglaries
text: police need help to identify this man following six distraction burglaries in leicester .
the burglar targeted elderly people in the westcotes and beaumont leys areas between 7 and 10 may .
money was stolen in the majority of the incidents .
we are linking all six distraction burglaries and hundreds of pounds have been taken in the incidents .
please take a look at the photo and if you recognise the man or have any details that can help , please call us . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: multi-million pound redevelopment planned for highcross
text: this is what the highcross in leicester could soon look like
the redevelopment plans come as house of fraser prepare to leave the shopping centre , freeing up a very large retail space .
the plans will provide the opportunity to upsize existing retailers to flagship standard stores and introduce new concepts to the city .

bringing previously underutilised areas of the scheme into active retail use will enable us to complete the streetscape at the entrance to st peter 's square and improve the integration between the high street and the scheme . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : icc champions trophy visits derby
text: a nice bit of bling has been in derby
said bling is the icc champions trophy and the icc women 's world cup .
the trophies are currently on tour around the uk ahead of tournaments next month .
thanks for visiting the roundhouse @ twitterid we 're absolutely delighted to have been part of the # nissantrophytour
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: radio leicester election debate to take place next month
text: do you want to be part of bbc radio leicester 's general election debate ?
it 's happening on tuesday 6 june between 18:00 and 19:00 at bbc radio leicester and is being hosted by ben jackson .
there 's more information on how to apply here .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: littleover homes affected by 'discoloured water '
text: some households in the littleover area may be seeing discoloured water coming from their taps .
engineers were sent to investigate and take routine samples from the de23 area .
severn trent has said they received five calls from customers over their discoloured water .
they 're advising people to run a cold tap slowly for about 20 minutes in order to fix the problem .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: euromillions winner to invest in alfreton town
text: alfreton town chairman wayne bradley believes euromillions winner lee mullen will add a breath of fresh air to the football club .
mr mullen scooped just under £ 5m in 2011 and has already invested in league two side grimsby town .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands weather update : sunny spells and mainly dry
text: there will be sunny spells and it will be mainly dry for the majority of the afternoon with the just the risk of a couple of showers .
highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: arrest after man 'assaulted and tied up in own home '
text: a man has been arrested on sus of aggravated burglary after a man was allegedly assaulted and tied up in his own home .
the incident happened in february but police have just released the details following the arrest this morning .
nottinghamshire police said a substantial amount of jewellery was stolen by two masked men .
the arrested man , 26 , remains in police custody .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : cctv released of duo after post office robbery in overseal
text: cctv footage of two men police would like to speak to has been released after a robbery at a post office in overseal .
police say two men entered the shop on lullington road , threatened staff and left with cash .
the robbery happened on tuesday at about 16:00 .
warning : third party content may contain ads .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : nottingham factory 's demand for pork pie variety
text: should a pork pie just be a pork pie ?
apparently not .
one of britain 's biggest pork pie factories , based in nottingham , seems to think variety is the name of the game .
the factory makes three million pork pies a week at pork farms on the queen 's drive industrial estate and supplies a wide range of retailers with their products .
all of these pies are baked in an oven longer than two double decker buses .
they 're currently experimenting with some new flavours , including a thai pie .
kim burgess , from the company , said this is one of the secrets to their success .
`` it 's very , very different but what we 're seeing is a growth of the younger consumers , under 28 , who just want variety , '' she said .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former mayor left severely ill for two years after ant bite
text: the former mayor of matlock , geoff stevens , has spoken of how he became severely ill with symptoms lasting up to two years - after being bitten by an ant .
mr stevens was preparing for the town 's victorian weekend when put his foot in an ants ' nest at hall leys park last christmas .
doctors had been stumped for months over the illness , but after extensive tests , it became apparent that the ant bite had caused his long spell of sickness .
it was just terrible .
my leg was very red and swollen , my foot was very large - there was no prospect of getting a shoe on .
it was very uncomfortable and because you run a very high temperature , that 's what the doctors were very concerned about . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : woman speaks of finding murdered friend
text: the bbc has been talking to the best friend of a woman from leicestershire who was murdered by her `` obsessive '' former boyfriend .
maxine mcgill found alice ruggles with her throat cut from ear to ear in october .
the pair were sharing a flat in gateshead where alice lived after studying at northumbria university .
serving soldier trimaan `` harry '' dhillon , 26 , was jailed for a minimum of 22 years for miss ruggles ' murder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : how easily can products be recycled ?
text: the recycling association has named a list of products that pose the biggest challenges for reuse .
among the list are items like pringles tubes and lucozade sport bottles - apparently the packaging contains too many different materials .
we 've been over to casepak recycling plant , just off scudamore road in leicester , to see how they are affected by these products
jacob smith at the plant said they actually do n't see these items as their `` biggest problem '' , however pringles tubes do need to have the metal bottom removed .
he said the worst items for them to receive are used nappies and fabric items like clothing .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: time right to leave mansfield - green
text: time right to leave mansfield - green

documents.title: breakingteenager charged with murder after leicester stabbing
text: a 17-year-old has been charged with the murder of abdirahman adam - who died in hospital after being found injured in st matthews way in leicester on monday .
a post-mortem examination into the 22-year-old 's death has revealed he died from a stab wound , leicestershire police said .
the teenager - who can not be named for legal reasons - has also been charged with possession of an offensive weapon in a public place .
he will appear at leicester magistrates ' court this morning .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: india international pujara set for nottinghamshire debut
text: india international cheteshwar pujara has arrived at trent bridge ahead of his four-game stint with nottinghamshire .
the 29-year-old is nottinghamshire 's overseas replacement for james pattinson , who has joined up with australia ahead of the champions trophy .
pujara is expected to make his debut against glamorgan on friday and is also set to feature in the side 's fixtures against gloucestershire ( home and away ) and derbyshire at trent bridge .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: university involved in growing 'world 's hottest ' chilli pepper
text: this might be a bit too much for even the biggest lovers of s food
this chilli pepper has been grown in wales and is believed to be the hottest in the world .
mike smith grew the dragon 's breath chilli with help from nottingham trent university .
the chilli has a scoville scale rating of 2.4 million units of heat .
mr smith said the chilli 's too hot to be eaten but can be used as an alternative to anaesthetic in third world countries .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new council leader speaks of 'huge task ' after appointment
text: councillor joe orson has been appointed the new leader of melton borough council .
councillor leigh higgins will remain deputy leader , while no reason has been given for councillor pam posnett 's departure .
i am extremely honoured to be invited to lead the council .

we have a huge task ahead with the local plan , pressing the case for the bypass and appointing a new chief executive , but also to continue to deliver on our commitment we made in 2015 on projects such as the cattle market , while we are making excellent progress on the leisure vision . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: radio derby election debate to take place at university
text: have you got any burning questions you want to ask the candidates for the derby north constituency ?
if so , come along to bbc radio derby 's election debate , which will be held at the university of derby on 1 june .
you can apply to be in the audience here .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: warning after flooding in sileby
text: no real surprise considering the amount of rain we had yesterday , but worth noting if you 're in the area
slash lane in sileby is passable but take care as the flood warden tells us water is covering much of the road
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rare gold brooch 'belonged to baroness '
text: a metal detectorist has found a brooch believed to have been lost by a baroness almost 550 years ago .
the rare 15th century gold heart-shaped brooch was discovered just outside the moat of kirby muxloe castle in leicestershire .
it is inlaid with white enamel and engraved with the medieval french inscription `` honor et ioie '' ( honour and joy ) .
the brooch will be auctioned on 23 august in derbyshire and has a guide price of £ 6,000 to £ 8,000 .
the finder , who wishes to remain anonymous , will split the proceeds of the auction with the landowner after the british museum declared it treasure but declined to purchase it .
the castle was built by william hastings , 1st baron hastings , who inherited his father 's seat at kirby muxloe in 1455 .
experts say the brooch would have been given to katherine neville , baroness hastings , by william .
the pair lived at the castle from 1480 and had six children .
it did n't end well for william though - as he was accused of treason and beheaded in 1483 .
the heart shaped jewel would only have been worn by the most powerful ladies of the day .
it is remarkable to think that this may have been a gift to katherine from william hastings .
it is likely the brooch fell from katherine whilst joyfully strolling the castle grounds , or was it lost in more sombre circumstances in the years following his sudden demise ? ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: long delays on the m1 and a52
text: a quick heads-up for commuters coming into derby
it looks like long delays on the m1 and a52 .
derbyshire police has told us they are n't aware of any accidents , but we will keep you updated .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on the roads
text: derby - there are severe delays on the a38 little eaton roundabout due to a collision
nottingham - there are delays of up to 45 minutes on the m1 southbound between junction 24a heading towards brian clough way towards derby road
leicester - there is queuing traffic on the a47 hinckley road in leicester forest east heading towards braunstone town
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather outlook
text: here 's how it 's looking today
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: crossing safety review continues after man hit by train
text: network rail has said it will continue to review a level crossing in nottinghamshire after a man was hit by a train yesterday .
yesterday 's incident took place at the meadow lane crossing in attenborough .
network rail began a public consultation about closing the crossing and two others on the line at the end of last year .
british transport police say the death is n't sus and investigations are ongoing .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: megan bannister death : two men charged with manslaughter
text: first up this morning
two men have been charged with gross negligence manslaughter following the death of a 16-year-old girl from leicester .
megan bannister 's body was found in the back seat of a car after a crash with a motorbike in enderby on sunday .
however , a post-mortem examination revealed megan 's injuries were not consistent with a road traffic collision .
jason burder , 28 , from braunstone avenue , leicester , and adam king , 27 , from waltham avenue , leicester , are due to appear at leicester magistrates ' court today .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning to you all across nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire - i 'll be writing today 's live page along with khia lewis-todd .
we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the east midlands .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
